title: GCS Establishment Treaty
content:
Treaty Establishing the Galactic Confederate Systems - GCS Constitution
Preamble
We, the representative star nations and civilizations of the galaxy, united in our commitment to peace, stability, and mutual prosperity, establish the Galactic Confederate Systems to foster cooperation, security, and advancement under GCS institutional oversight.
Article 1: Establishment
The Galactic Confederate Systems (Confederation) is established by [signees] and is open to those respecting its values and committed to its objectives.
Article 2: Objectives
The Confederation aims to promote galactic peace and stability, foster economic cooperation, ensure collective security, encourage scientific and technological innovation, protect cultural heritage, and facilitate free movement of goods, services, and citizens.
Article 3: Membership
Membership is open to star nations meeting GCS criteria, requiring two-thirds GCS Council approval and consensus from existing members. Members operate under GCS institutional guidance.
Article 4: Withdrawal
Members retain the right to withdraw at any time and must notify the GCS Council and settle outstanding commitments.
Article 5: Institutions
Section 1: The GCS Council
The GCS Council comprises representatives from each member state, with 10 per nation and 16 for the GCS Core. It enacts laws, approves budgets, oversees Confederation policies, and amends the Treaty. Elections are held every ten years, with sessions convening annually. The Council elects a Speaker for a five year term.
Section 2: Government of Confederate Ministers
The Government of Confederate Ministers is elected by the GCS Council, representing all parliamentary factions. It leads executive functions, implements policies, and coordinates Confederation institutions. Headed by a Confederate Prime Minister, it is accountable to the GCS Council.
Section 3: Other Institutions
Galactic Assembly: Advises the GCS Council.
Galactic Court of Justice: Interprets laws and resolves disputes.
Confederate Security Force: Coordinates defense; members contribute at least 100 fleet units.

Article 6: Emergency Powers of the GCS Core
In situations deemed emergencies, including large-scale invasion, widespread civil unrest, catastrophic natural disasters, parliamentary deadlock, or the inability to form a government, the GCS Core Government shall have the authority to enact and implement policies, decisions, and regulations without the prior approval of the GCS Council, to ensure swift and effective response.
These emergency powers include, but are not limited to:
Policy Implementation: The GCS Core may implement policies and decisions that are deemed necessary for addressing the emergency, provided they do not conflict with existing laws or the Constitution.
Resource Allocation: The GCS Core may allocate and redirect resources, including fleet units, personnel, and supplies, to address the emergency, ensuring efficient and effective response.
Emergency Measures: The GCS Core may take immediate action in response to the emergency, with such measures subject to post-hoc review by the GCS Council to ensure their necessity and proportionality.
The GCS Core shall inform the GCS Council of any actions taken under this authority at the earliest opportunity, providing a detailed account of the measures and their justification.
The GCS Council shall have the authority to review and, if necessary, revoke any actions taken by the GCS Core under this authority, by a two-thirds majority vote, if it deems the measures unnecessary, disproportionate, or in conflict with the interests of the Confederation.
Article 7: Economic Cooperation
The Confederation establishes a common economic framework to facilitate trade and development under GCS guidance.
Article 8: Collective Security
Members commit to mutual defense, with the Confederate Security Force coordinating efforts under GCS oversight.
Article 9: Scientific and Cultural Exchange
The Confederation promotes scientific research and cultural exchange to drive progress and celebrate diversity.
Article 10: Capital and Official Languages
The capital is on Basis, adjacent to the SDO headquarters, with multiple official languages recognized.
Article 11: Citizenship
Confederation citizenship is established for nationals of member states, with defined rights and duties.
Article 12: Economic and Monetary Union
An economic and monetary union with the Galactic Credit as currency is managed by the Galactic Central Bank under GCS oversight.
Article 13: Common Foreign and Security Policy
The Confederation defines and implements a unified foreign and security policy to protect common values and interests.
Article 14: Area of Freedom, Security, and Justice
The Confederation ensures an area of freedom, security, and justice, respecting fundamental rights and legal traditions.
Article 15: Environmental Policy
Sustainable development and environmental protection are promoted across member states.
Article 16: Research and Technological Development
The Confederation strengthens scientific and technological bases to drive innovation and competitiveness.
Article 17: Energy and Transport Policy
Policies ensure energy security, efficiency, and the integration of transport states.
Article 18: Education and Public Health
The Confederation supports education and public health initiatives to foster understanding and well-being.
Article 19: Amendments
Amendments require a two-thirds majority GCS Council agreement and approval by all member states.
Article 20: Ratification
This Treaty is ratified according to member states' constitutional requirements and enters into force upon deposit of ratification instruments with the GCS Council.



In witness whereof, the undersigned representatives have signed this Treaty.


Done in unity and cooperation, on this day of galactic concord, under GCS institutional oversight.
